question: Does metformin interfere thyroxine absorption?
ideal_answer: No. There are not reported data indicating that metformin reduce with thyroxine absorption.

snippets.text: LT4 absorption is unchanged by concomitant metformin ingestion.
It has been hypothesized that metformin may suppress serum thyrotropin (TSH) concentrations by enhancing LT4 absorption or by directly affecting the hypothalamic-pituitary axis.
